passages.text: China (PRC) | Semiconductors AMEC

2Q25 rev beat driven by robust growth in etcher and mass delivery pf LPCVD. GM/EBIT missed due to some one- off costs, certain discount and R&D staying at high level. New orders \(+40\%\) YoY in 1H25, and contract liabilities and inventory kept going up YoY/QoQ, positive signs for promising pipelines of customers demand, alleviating potential impact from fab capex slowdown. Mgt saw strong capacity expansion on advanced logic as a key driver in 2025. Maintain BUY.

2Q25 mixed. AMEC's 2Q25 rev increased \(51\%\) YoY to Rmb2,787m, beating JEFe/cons by \(18\% /3\%\) mainly driven by robust growth in etcher \((+40\%)\) YoY in 1H25) and mass delivery of LPCVD (7x YoY to Rmb199m in 2H25). GM dropped 1.7ppt YoY to \(38.5\%\) missing JEFe/cons by 2.8ppt/3.2ppt due to 1) new tools' ramp with relatively high one- off costs at the beginning, and 2) certain discount to big customers, and mgt was confident on maintaining \(>40\%\) GM in 2025 and going forward. EBIT grew \(24\%\) missing JEFe/cons by \(27\% /29\%\) as R&D remained at a high level focusing on high- end tools \((+4\) ppt to \(23\%\) as of rev, \(+84\%\) YoY). NP increased \(47\%\) YoY, beating JEFe/cons by \(37\% /2\%\) thanks to FV gain of Rmb163m, while adj. NP excluding one- off items missing JEFe/cons by \(17\% /38\%\)

Ongoing momentum in localization rate hike and new products reflected in robust contract liabilities to offset fab capex uncertainties. AMEC is currently working on \(>90.1\) high- aspect ratio etcher to overcoming the monopoly of overseas vendors in this area, which may start to enter the market soon if going smoothly. New orders \(+40\%\) in 1H25, and by end 2Q25, contract liabilities grew \(25\%\) YoY and kept expanding QoQ to Rmb3.2bn, and inventory rose \(19\% /8\%\) YoY/QoQ mainly due to products delivered to clients but pending validation, all are positive signs for solid demand going forward which could largely alleviate some concerns on China fabs' capex slowdown in our view (mgt thought overall capex \(- 10\%\) YoY in this year). As the US may potentially further tighten export controls on SPE to China, we believe the long- term growth trend in the localization rate (vs currently \(15 - 20\%\) overall and \(20 - 25\%\) in etching) is intact. Any technique breakthrough from advanced logic and memory customers potentially in the next few quarters may also bring about robust orders to local SPE vendors.

Rapid capacity expansion on advanced logic. Mgt pointed out China memory fab expanded a lot in past 2 years, while slowing down in near- term. On the other hand, advanced logic has witnessed strong cape pace in 1H25, and mgt expected to see rapid order growth from advanced logicfabs in 2H25 as a key driver.
We are meeting AMEC at CSEAC 2025 in Wuxi. CSEAC is the annual SPE exhibition in China. Join us if you are interested in Chinese SPE!

Maintain BUY. We slightly cut our 2025E NP forecasts to factor in relatively high R&D efforts for a breakthrough on high- end tools but raise the following years' forecast. We maintain BUY at a new PT of Rmb248.00 based on 50x 2026E P/E, which suggests \(16\%\) potential upside.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 11 - 16 of this report. \\*Jefferies Hong Kong Limited
TARGET I ESTIMATE CHANGE

China foundries will likely expand capacities aggressively as they can still get access to immersive DUV tools AMEC will continue benefiting from the China localization trend AMEC is forecast to capture \(11\% /22\%\) of domestic etching equipment demand as a leading local supplier by 2026/2030 AMEC is not just a localization story; its technology is leading in etching and able to capture the non- Chinese market
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

China SPE demand stable Steady repeat orders and new customer acquisitions AMEC holds \(7\% /14\% /24\%\) of China semiconductor etching equipment market share by 2024/27E/30E PT of Rmb248.00 is based on \(79\times 50\times\) 2025E/26E P/E

China SPE demand accelerated Better- than- expected repeat orders and new customers acquisition AMEC holds \(7\% /17\% /27\%\) of China semiconductor etching equipment market share by 2024/27E/30E PT of Rmb273.33 is based on \(87\times 48\times\) 2025E/26E P/E

China SPE demand delayed Worse- than- expected repeat orders and new customers acquisition AMEC holds \(7\% /12\% /22\%\) of China semiconductor etching equipment market share by 2024/27E/30E PT of Rmb188.51 is based on \(60\times 42\times\) 2025E/26E P/E

AMEC as a SPE manufacturer generates GHG emission and requires a large amount of stable power from the power grid (mostly fossil fuel). Thus it is important to implement energy saving measures and new tech to reduce pollution. Manage potential materials shortages, supply disruptions and price volatility to ensure timely order delivery or otherwise cause the delay of downstream capacity expansion.

Adopt Facility Management and Control System to enhance efficiency, extend PPE's life and save labor cost Reduce energy input and emission load of plants through technology upgrade. Nurture local suppliers through on- site examination and training and increase the localization rate of component supply to mitigate risk.

How would you manage continuous raw materials price hike and long lead time of components supply to meet downstream partners' expansion plan? What is the target % of localization in your SPE products' components? Any possibility to eventually achieve \(100\%\)

Faster- than- expected capacity expansion and process migration of AMEC's customers Better- than- expected new tools development progress Recovering domestic LED spending on the tailwind of Mini LED and Micro LED adoption Potential M&A opportunity Fewer sanctions by DoC on Chinese customers

Advanced Micro- Fabrication Equipment (AMEC) is a China- based global semiconductor microfabrication equipment company. AMEC specializes in equipment used to develop and produce micro- sized and nanoscale- sized VLSIs, focusing on chemical vapor deposition and plasma etching products.

Our PT of Rmb248.00 is based on 79x/50x 2025E/26E P/E. Key risks include: 1) Further sanction from US Department of Commerce, 2) Slowerthan- expected customer capacity expansion, 3) Slower- than- expected new customer acquisition outside China, and 4) Slower- than- expected new tool development.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stocks selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
